alert.note: Alert for Kerr (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 6:46AM CDT until October 26 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Gillespie, Kerr and Llano. * WHEN...Until 730 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 645 AM CDT, Doppler radar continues to show heavy rain due to heavy showers. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected shortly across the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over some areas of the advisory. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kerrville, Fredericksburg, Kingsland, Llano, Comfort, Gainesville, Horseshoe Bay, Ingram, Buchanan Lake Village, Stonewall, Rocky Hill, Eckert, Cain City, Blumenthal, Willow City, Luckenbach, Grapetown, LBJ State Park, Tivydale and Albert. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
